document.masterDocTitle: A monograph of the Afrotropical Cassidinae (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae). Part 4. Revision of the genus Chiridopsis Spaeth

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A monograph of the Afrotropical Cassidinae (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae). Part 4. Revision of the genus Chiridopsis Spaeth

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Chiridopsis Boutareli
Spaeth, 1924 : 352
, 1933 a: 356;
Borowiec, 1999 : 298
.
Chirida subgibbosa
Spaeth, 1917 : 442
,
n. syn.

Chiridopsis boutareli
ab.
subgibbosa :
Spaeth, 1933 a : 356
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Eyes very large, gena obsolete. Clypeus broad, approximately 1.4 times as wide as long. Clypeal grooves fine but well marked, converging in regular triangle, surface of clypeus slightly convex, shiny with few very small, setose punctures. Labrum minutely emarginate to 1/5 length. Antennae slim, segments 9–10 approximately 1.6 times as long as wide. Length ratio of antennal segments: 100:45:58:61:58:47:66:53:63:63:116. Segment 3 approximately 1.3 times as long as segment 2 and approximately 0.9 times as long as segment 4.

Prosternum broad in the middle, strongly expanded apically, area between coxa flat, surface without special sculpture, shiny, with few setose punctures, expanded apex flat, without special sculpture, shiny, with few setose punctures.
Distribution. Central Africa from Republic of Central Africa to N Angola ( fig. 3 ).

Remarks. We examined syntypes of
Chirida boutareli Spaeth
and
Chiridopsis subgibbosa Spaeth
and they are conspecific. Elytral convexity varies among samples from the same locality from regularly convex to slightly gibbous in postscutellar area.

This species belongs to the group of taxa with black vitta along margin of elytral disc, broadly black suture and broad band across elytra.
Chiridopsis boutareli
and
Ch. opposita
( figs 43–45 , 87–89 ) are the only similarly coloured species with clypeus and ventrites yellow.
Chiridopsis opposita
differs in elytral band V-shaped, thin to moderately broad, approximately equal width in lateral and sutural part ( figs 87, 88 ) while in
Ch. boutareli
the band is narrowest in the lateral connection and broadest in the sutural part but with a posterior narrow yellow emargination along sutural connection, sometimes the yellow emargination complete, thus the band is narrowly interrupted along suture, or black band broadened and enclosing two small yellow spots near suture ( figs 43, 44 ).

: [ REPUBLIC OF CONGO ] Brazzaville , Boutarel (MM, ZMHU ).
